intro: Clethra macrostachya, commonly known as sweet pepperbush, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 feet and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy beneath. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Clethra macrostachya is often found in moist, acidic soils in woodlands and stream valleys.
